ol.li: The lamb is presented without the Agpeya prayers of the hours.
"Lord have mercy (Kurie Ele/~con)" (41 times) is not chanted, but rather the lamb is examined in silence as Christ who was silent when tried before Pilate and did not open his mouth (Isa 53:7).
Anak Domba dipersembahkan tanpa doa-doa Agpeya dalam jam-jam tertentu.

Ya Tuhan kasihanilah (Kyrie Eleison)" (41 kali) tidak dinyanyikan, melainkan Anak Domba diperiksa dalam keheningan, seperti Kristus yang diam ketika diadili di hadapan Pilatus dan tidak membuka mulut-Nya (Yesaya 53:7).

comment.language: The priest purifies his thoughts and actions, internally and externally, and, most important, he must be internally pure of all transgressions, lest he receive judgment onto himself according to the saying of St. Paul in 1 Corinthians 11:27-31, and he shall be at peace with all men (Matthew 5:23, 24; Mark 11:25-26). He must be externally clean in body and clothing, with his hands and feet washed (Exodus 30:17-21), and he must be careful not to taste anything at all.

Imam menyucikan pikiran dan tindakannya, baik secara batiniah maupun lahiriah, dan yang paling penting, ia harus murni secara batin dari segala pelanggaran, agar ia tidak mendatangkan hukuman atas dirinya sendiri menurut perkataan St. Paulus dalam 1 Korintus 11:27-31. Ia juga harus berdamai dengan semua orang (Matius 5:23-24; Markus 11:25-26). Secara lahiriah, ia harus bersih dalam tubuh dan pakaian, dengan tangan dan kaki yang dicuci (Keluaran 30:17-21), dan ia harus berhati-hati untuk tidak mencicipi apa pun sama sekali.

يجب أن يستبرئ الكاهن أفكاره وأحواله داخلاً وخارجاً. ففي الداخل وهو الأهم يجب أن يكون نقياً من كلِّ زلة، لئلا يأخذ دينونة لنفسه، كقول القديس بولس الرسول (كورنثوس الأولى 11: 27-31)، ويكون الكاهن مصطلحاً مع الجميع (راجع متى 5: 23، 24؛ مرقس 11: 25-26). وفي الخارج يجب أن يكون نظيف الجسم والملابس، ويغسل يديه ورجليه (راجع 30: 17-21)، ويكون محترساً، أي لم يذق شيئاً البتة.

comment.language: On the three major feasts of Nativity, Theophany, and Resurrection, the oblations are offered and examined without chanting "Lord have mercy (Kurie e~Le/~con)" (41 times).
Pada tiga hari raya besar, yaitu Natal, Teofani, dan Kebangkitan, persembahan dipersembahkan dan diperiksa tanpa melantunkan "Ya Tuhan kasihanilah (Kyrie Eleison)" (41 kali).
On the Feast of Pentecost, only the psalms of the Third Hour and the Gospel are prayed. The litanies are prayed after the reading of the Praxis (Acts).
Pada Hari Raya Pentakosta, hanya mazmur-mazmur dari Jam Ketiga dan Injil yang didoakan. Litani didoakan setelah pembacaan Praxis (Kisah Para Rasul).

On the weekdays of the Great Fast and Jonah’s Fast and the Paramoun of the Feasts of Nativity and Theophany, the prayers of the Third, Sixth, Ninth, Vespers and Compline hours (and Veil in the monasteries) are prayed.

Pada hari-hari biasa selama Puasa Besar, Puasa Yunus, dan Paramoun dari Hari Raya Natal serta Teofani, doa-doa dari Jam Ketiga, Keenam, Kesembilan, Vesper, dan Kompletorium (serta doa Tirai di biara-biara) didoakan.
On non-fasting days (including Saturdays and Sundays of fasting days, as well as Feasts of the Lord and Feasts of the Cross), the prayers of the Third and Sixth hours are prayed.
Pada hari-hari tidak berpuasa (termasuk Sabtu dan Minggu hari-hari puasa, serta Hari Raya Tuhan dan Hari Raya Salib), doa jam Ketiga dan Keenam dilaksanakan.
On fasting days (except the weekdays of the Great Fast and Jonah’s fast) the prayers of the Third, Sixth and Ninth hours are prayed.
Pada hari-hari puasa, kecuali pada hari-hari tertentu dalam minggu yaitu Puasa Besar dan Puasa Yunus, dipanjatkan doa pada Jam Ketiga, Keenam, dan Kesembilan.

Then the priest rises and kisses the altar, and proceeds to the north side of the altar, and the deacon who is serving prostrates before him, and the priest stretches forth his hand on the deacon and blesses him. Then both of them kiss the altar. Coming down from the altar, the priest and the rest of the deacons walk backward, their faces set to the East, and they put their left foot first. Then they prostrate themselves before the door of the sanctuary, and one of the priests who are present reads the Prayer of Absolution. If the Pope, a metropolitan, or a bishop is present, he reads this prayer. If only one priest is present, he reads it while standing behind the servants.
